title: 6 Must do Things in Kerala
text:
6 Must do Things in Kerala 6 Must do Things in Kerala 0 
Tourists who visited Kerala is fascinated by its captivated beauty. Its wide-spread lush green landscape, carpets of spice and tea plantations, soothing backwaters, magnificent hill station, exotic wildlife and serene beaches, make this place a unique tourist point for both domestic as well as foreign tourists. Kerala so far is the best and most preferred honeymoon destination in India. The question may come in one's mind that what are the things one should experience while visiting Kerala; here are some of the tips one should follow while visiting Kerala. 
1. Take a Boat ride in the Periyar Lake: The Periyar Lake was formed in the year 1985 across the Mullaperiyar River by building a dam. A boat ride on this unique aquatic ecosystem system will make one's Periyar tour absolutely incredible. The Periyar Lake is located at the heart of the sanctuary and an ideal place to watch animals and birds on the bank of this lake. 
During boating one can enjoy the tranquility of this lake surrounded by huge greenery and exotic wildlife. Wild animals (Deers, Elephants, and Rhino) and various unseen birds are coming alongside of the lake for drinking, bathing, resting and scavenging. The lake is said to have more than 30 species of fish. River Otter is the only mammal in the lake, can also be seen sometimes during the ride. This adventurous and delightful boating is arranged by the Kerala Tourism Development Corporation (KTDC) and the State Forest Department and the 
2. Watch Incredible Waterfalls: Waterfalls in Kerala are one of the most popular tourist's destination and excursion spot for its alluring beauty. Numerous waterfalls of different sizes are seen all across the lush green forest of the Western Ghats. These waterfalls are considered to be the most adventurous places due to its thundering splash and roaring voice of the falls from huge height. Some Waterfalls offer a space like pool below the falls for swimming. One can be spell bounded by seeing these incredible waterfalls. 
Some of the most incredible and famous waterfalls of Kerala are Athirapally, Cheeyappara, Vazhachal, Thommankuthu, Palaruvi, Tusharagiri, Nyayamkadu waterfalls. Kerala Holidays will not be accomplished without visiting any of these waterfalls. 
3. Enjoy the Exotic Wildlife at Kerala: Kerala tour is incomplete without experiencing the exotic wildlife of Kerala. Kerala is a hub of a wide array of fauna such as Leopard, Nilgiri Tahr, Asian Elephant, Bengal Tiger, Grizzled Giant and more. Some endangered species like Indian Bison, Lion-tailed Macaque are found in the Silent Valley national park located in the Kundali Hills harbor. There are more than 450 species of birds in Kerala covering rare species such as Oriental Bay Owl, Sri Lankan Frogmouth, Hornbilland Indian Grey as well as the common species like Oriental Darter, Peafowl, Hill Myna, Drongo, Jungle Fowl, Kingfisher, Water Fowl, Woodpecker, and other migratory birds. Reptilians include Python King Cobra, Viper, and the more common Crocodile and Turtle. 
There are 15 famous sanctuaries in Kerala- Eravikulam National Park, Chinnar Wildlife Sanctuary, , Periyar Wildlife Sanctuary, , Kumarakom Bird Sanctuary, Peppara Wildlife Sanctuary, Peechi-Vaazhaani Wildlife Sanctuary, Silent Valley National Park, Wayanad Sanctuary, Thattekkad Bird Sanctuary, Aralam Wildlife Sanctuary, Chimmini Wildlife Sanctuary, Wildlife Idukki Wildlife Sanctuary, Parambikulam Wildlife Sanctuary, Neyyar Wildlife Sanctuary, Chenthuruni Sanctuary (Shenduruny Wildlife Sanctuary),. One should visit at least some of these adventures and enthralling wildlife sanctuaries of Kerala for an extraordinary thrilling experience. 
4. Trekking in Kerala: While visiting Kerala, tourists intend to have an adventurous trekking experience. Kerala offers some of the most spellbinding destinations where one can fulfill his desires of trekking some of the most amazing destinations to trek in Kerala are -Ponmudi, Munnar, Wayand, Periyar, Chembra Peaks, Anamudi Peaks, Rajmala Hills, Agasthyakoodam, Devikulam, Vagamon. 
Trekking in the forests or trekking in peaks, gives a breathtaking experience for the tourists. During forest trekking, travelers get the chance to spot the wild animals like elephants, Sambars and deer's. One can also enjoy trekking to the mountains of interesting places like Munnar, Wayanad and Chembra. While trekking in the hills visitor get the scope to relish various jungle treks. 
5. Pamper yourself with a rejuvenating Ayurveda message: one should rejuvenate and relax oneself not only by enjoying the beauty of the nature of God's own country, but also one must undergo through the traditional healing Ayurveda Massages and spa. 
Kerala is a hub of Ayurveda treatment. Ayurvedic herbal massage can make one wonderfully relaxing and revitalizing. Some of the most effective Ayurvedictherapic are- Abhyangam, Sirodhara, Panchakarma, Pizhichil, Njavarakizhi, Kativasthi, Sirovasthi, Elakizhi and Nasyam 
6. Watch traditional Kathakali& Martial Art: Kathakali is the most renowned form of dance drama in Kerala. The word Kathakali means "Story-Play". It is recognized for its large costumes and huge makeup. The themes of the Kathakali are religious in nature. They typically deal with the Ramayana and Mahabharata, This is performed in language Sanskritised Malayalam. On the other hand the Martial art form of Kerala is the oldest form of combat. Kerala's local people perform both Kathakali and Martial at various places in Kerala. One must spend a few hours by watching these most amazing performances while visiting Kerala to get the real taste of Kerala's old traditional culture. Kerala is a place of endless beauty. One must not leave the chance to places to visit in Kerala for at least once in his lifetime. Tourists from various parts of the world came to Kerala to experience the real essence of its natural resources, its lifestyle and traditional culture. Rate this Article
